title: Jos Verstappen: Max should have kept quiet
text:
Red Bull driver Max Verstappen's father says the Red Bull driver should not have commented on the yellow flag situation following Valtteri Bottas' qualifying crash in Mexico.

After audaciously admitting to not slowing down for the incident and daring the FIA to "delete my lap", 22-year-old Verstappen lost his pole position.

Silence is the answer

Formula 1 race director Michael Masi is now vowing to speak "one on one" with Verstappen about safety and yellow flags in Austin.

"We have discussed the press conference," Max's father Jos, a former F1 driver, told Ziggo Sport.

READ | 'He's a magnet for those kind of things' - Lewis Hamilton hits out at 'silly' Verstappen style

"I think he shouldn't have said anything. Max also told me that he had not seen the yellow flags at all, which I understand, because normally you are informed by your team in such a moment.

"He also saw that other people were not lifting the gas, so Max is disappointed that only he got the penalty.

"But I see it as another learning moment for Max. He just has to buy some time next time," Jos Verstappen added.

"Max's heart is sometimes on his tongue, which is just the way he is, but apparently that is not always possible in a top sport. It's nice that Max is always straightforward, but this time he shouldn't have said anything," he concluded.
description: Max Verstappen's father says the Red Bull driver should not have commented on the yellow flag situation following Valtteri Bottas' qualifying crash in Mexico.
